intro: Justicia bequaertii, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of red, tubular flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last from late spring to early autumn.
